The perfect melange of a powerful and well scripted story with touching characterisation. It's makes us feel what each of the characters are feeling on screen. And above all films are a medium to connect with the people and only a very few does that these days , well this one is one among the few! It puts forth very strong message in the most realistic way possible with out much artificial flavours.

Review title: The Best film from Indian Cinema
Review_body: JaiBhim is must movie for each and every Indian. The film was social Drama also gives the Thrilling Experience because of their best story narration by the Director. Also it is the real issue happened 1995 period.

When an issue for a rich family crop up, the police, politicians, and judicial systems stands up for them and the greatest lawyers in the country are hired to speak against them and ensure that even though guilty are released with ease. But, in the same scenario when a poor or a backward caste family are stuck around courts seeking justice everything just falls apart. Jai Bhim showcases a story about an honest lawyer who stands for such issues and about a tribal family who seeks justice for their innocence for a case that has been upheld against them.There have been many movies in the past showcasing the issues that the backward caste / tribal people go through by the injustice done by the society as if they don't exist in the normal population. They are treated as a different set of people and termed as UNTOUCHABLES.Since 2020 when OTT is on a rise, there have been multiple movies that have opted for OTT as their route and with no second thoughts Jai Bhim stands out in all the ways. Be it a thought-provoking subject, courtroom drama, people's attitude towards backward, troubles that tribal people face, and to prove that they exist in society. This reminds me of Ambedkar's fight to abolish untouchability in India which still exists in greater parts of India. This plot showcases the story based on true events revolving around a 1995 habeas corpus petition that human rights. (Fundamental right in the Constitution that protects against unlawful and indefinite imprisonment)Suriya once again proves that be it any subject, if done with conviction and honesty will reach people's hearts. His simplicity throughout shows his sincerity towards the character. The other characters in the story are apt as per the proceedings. The initial premise of 25 mins is slow as it sets the stage for the main plot and when the protagonist appears on the screen, that's when the real proceedings follow. There are no punch dialogues or any massy numbers which a regular movie-goer would expect. This is a serious subject which every section should watch and applaud for! The emotions of the tribal people are heart-wrenching (Police station episodes are raw and rustic). The logic in the proceedings never go for a toss, each and every dot connection shows the perfection while execution.To sum up, Jai Bhim proves it point of the empathy that the poor or the tribal people are looking for and this one when ends would stay in your heart for a long time! Very Well Written and executed! (Language is no barrier, Amazon Prime has released the movie in all major languages 😉)

Review title: This Film depicts how the caste discrimination exploited the under privileged Lower caste film.
Review_body: The story formed the spine of this film. Kudos to Surya and Jyothika for taking up the project and bringing the reality of the lower caste people. PA Ranjith as usual you are the hero for the oppressed community! Brilliant acting by Surya, prakash raj and mainly the core tribal characters! It's because of Dr. B R Ambedkar that lower caste community is surviving in present India else we would've seen 10X stories of jai bheem which may not brought to light. Don't know what makes it wrong to be a lower caste people in this society. Still today the upper caste people exploit the society. Jai Bheem✊✊

Review title: Movie is Worthy and Must watch.
Review_body: One of the best movie I've seen. Hats off to Jai Bhim team, actor Suriya doesn't show any heroism in entire movie!! Wonderful screenplay.A must watch movie as it tells the importance of how diligent workers like police and law should be united for the betterment of a society. Lastly , a great salute to the real life hero Chandru (lawyer) who has handled this case and brought justice to the irular tribals in the late 90s.

Review title: Great Great and Very Great Movie
Review_body: I have watched many movies but never gave rating or review to any movie. But after watching this movie, I could not stop myself from giving reviews and ratings. After watching this movie I realized that what would have been the situation during the time of Dr. Babasaheb and how much struggles he would have done for backward society and fixed reservation to get the rights of backward society. And when I came to know that this is based on a true incident then I don't know how right and wrong it is to compare Mr. Chandru with Dr. Babasaheb, but both the great personalities have worked for the poor and backward people to get their rights. I think this movie should be awarded with Oscar.

Great efforts! After long time got to see some sensible movie with excellent direction and acting. Amazing work by entire team..since it was based on true story, it felt like seeing real characters..

Please read if u have time:
it may contain plot spoilers.It has been an hour since I watched the film..
I just cant get over the film, the emotions that I am experiencing is overwhelming...I find rats disgusting.. but there is a entire community of people finding, killing and eating rats for survival..I have never set foot inside a police station ever in my life, but there is a entire community of people who are being harassed, tortured and killed to accept a crime that they have not committed.Being a young adult, the impact this film has, is nothing short of life changing..
in my opinion, students above the age of 15 should be made to watch a censored version of this movie so that they can understand the sad and true state of the society they live in and learn what equality really is.I say censored version because, students cannot handle the brutal use of police force and lockup violence in the film, I just cannot help but wonder, if we think that our children cannot handle a 2 hr long film,
imagine the plight of the children of the people getting dragged out of their homes in the middle of the night, getting stomped on their faces, their mothers getting harassed, their livelihoods getting thrown out the window in a fraction of a second.. such is the sad state of the society we live in.I don't think I can type everything that I am thinking right now in this space..I don't wish to be a critic of such a film and applaud the characters, point out the flaws if any, appreciate the technical aspects of the film.. nope.. not going to..just one word.. if u want your children to treat everyone equally and learn about humanity and mankind... watch it along with them...
after the film ends.. tell them this,every person is equal and each and every man/women deserves respect, be it the servant who work in our homes, a driver who opens the car door for you every morning, the house keeping staff that clean your school bathroom, the security anna who stands by the gate, the grandfathers and grandmothers that come to collect garbage daily from our house, the people who clean our septic tanks and drainage.. tell them that in no way they are neither beneath us nor we above them... I bet they will understand and change the society for better.Jai bhim!

Review title: Path-breaking! Tribute to Dr. Ambedkar "Jai Bhim"
Review_body: Excellent movie a master piece direction depicting reality "as is" away from the stereotype nonsensical movies that drifts the nation from meaning generation commitment towards nation building in it true democratic principles. Jai Bhim provides answers to the questions that have not raised for centuries in this nation full of inequality disguise under religious caste dogma. This 164 minutes movie lay bares the sanctimonious democracy that we proudly flaunt as world largest. This century old discrimination is worst of its kind while in other countries even in a lesser form had resulted in social revolutions. In the movie we hear the voice of Dr. Ambedkar, the alone crusader of social justice condemning the human discrimination had still hoped that his countrymen will one day realize if not in his life time but maybe later when the history will be reviewed unbiased and his role to established social reform would be studied as pinnacle of social revolution failed by his own countrymen. The movie title "Jai Bhim" which is proudly used to greet each other by lakhs of Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar followers and Buddhists alike justifies the vision of the father of modern India Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar to educate, organize and agitate against any form of discrimination.
Best film from the point of view of social awareness which is based on true incident. All the actors of the film have played their role well, I would like to thank all the actors from the heart.

It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

Review title: jai bhim is An eye-opening honest tale
Review_body: Jai Bhim is honest and is focused about the brutality of the cops, caste discrimination, the pain of Irulas and how a woman stands against the system with the support of an honest advocate. The best part of Jai Bhim is the screenplay and the hard-hitting narration. The courtroom episodes are well packed. Each and every actor is too good with their performances which makes Jai Bhim a must-watch if you are fond of realistic tales. Jai Bhim sounds like an investigative thriller. Suriya's role has no elevations that a lead actor has in a South Indian film. He behaves like the other role in the film. He plays the role of an activist and an advocate who takes up issues that are ignored in the society. The drama looks narrated in detail and the custodial torture is quite brutal. The climax delivers the justice.
Fantastic screenplay, surya sir prove our acting as beat actor, level of acting prove him I'm not only mass actor also perfect actor. Come back and best actor in industry.

Review title: Jai Bhim is realistic courtroom drama
Review_body: Jai Bhim gets the best out of its ensemble of actors, who all turn in great performances. Suriya gives a formidable performance that is measured yet intense. Even though Chandru anchors the film, Jai Bhim truly belongs to the tribal couple Sengeni (Lijomol) and Rajakannu (Manikandan). Lijomol takes the cake with a phenomenal performance. She plays Sengeni with such a beautiful combination of dignity, innocence, and spirit that she becomes the soul of Jai Bhim. Lijomol is fantastically supported by Manikandan, who plays Rajakannu. The film also thankfully avoids forcing a romantic relationship between Chandru and Maithra (Rajisha Vijayan ). In the Tamil mainstream, the top reason to have a female character is still to play the love interest to the hero. Her importance to the story becomes less important. It is refreshing to see a star film sidestep this.
Hard hitting story, some events might even be true, excellent performance by everyone. Most of the scenes look realistic, raw but that makes this movie what it is.

The story is told in real movies about the caste system. How difficult it is for the common man to get justice in our country. This story tells the story of how the Dalit tribals have to struggle to get their justice.

Review title: Story of words for the movie excellence
Review_body: A BIG kudos to the team. Well written, directed and jaw-dropping scenes throughout the movie. Suriya sir as usual at his utmost best 👏. Director a big congratulations on the success. The actor did a stupendous job especially Lijomol Jose and K. Manikandan. The little girl as well who played as the daughter of Lijomol Jose acted well as.All in all, the best movie in recent times, Suriya sir 👏👍.

Jai Bhim is one of the finest films ever made in Indian history. A big star like Suriya decides to bolster the cause of the marginalised and the downtrodden and it's such a respectable action from his side.

N a scene in Jai Bhim, a group of tribals man meet a police office who is heading an inquiry commission about the disappearance of three missing tribals who were being interrogated by the police about a theft case. One man tells him that he was once arrested by cops just for greeting them. Another tells him about how he was arrested just because he tried to slink away fearing them. A woman narrates how her husband was forced to 'confess' to a crime which he had not committed after the cops started molesting her. A young boy mentions that the police picked him up just because they could not get his father, and how that one incident made him a perennial suspect at school. These people are clearly damned if they did, and damned if they didn't.This scene is an echo of the scene that opens the film. We see many prisoners being let out of prison. A few cops from the surrounding police stations are waiting. As each prisoner comes out, he is asked for his caste. If they mention a dominant caste's name, they are asked to leave. But those who belong to a scheduled caste or scheduled tribe, they are told to stand in a corner, only for the waiting cops to pick them up as suspects in the many cases that remain unsolved in their station. When some of them complain that there are too few for them to foist cases on, they are told that they could accuses a few of committing more than one crime.

Making a movie out of a real story is never easy.If the story is one of gross injustice and crimes against humanity it is almost an impossible task to bring it live onto the screens.'Jai Bhim' defies this supposition with an exceptional display of acting, screenplay and situational story telling.The director makes us step into the shoes of each of the main characters of this unbearable story of brutality towards the underdogs of a society. The movie has gone a long way into trying to wake up the human conscience to the tragic, ugly & inevitable consequences of casteism in a society.People like Justice Chandru are the real uncelebrated heroes. They give us hope, optimism and faith in the good human spirit.

#JaiBhimOne of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.The director unquestionably has to be awarded for the stupendous success of this movie which solely entertains family audiences without depending upon masala factor or "mass"components.I would definitely watch it again as it was based on detailed portrayal of true events & people!Hats off to the entire Cast & Crew, Team of Jai Bhim! Cheers!

Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar 14 April 1891 - 6 December 1956), venerated as Babasaheb was an Indian jurist, economist, politician and social reformer, who inspired the Dalit Buddhist movement and campaigned against social discrimination towards the untouchables (Dalits). He was British India's Minister of Labour in Viceroy's Executive Council, Chairman of the Constituent Drafting committee, independent India's first Minister of Law and Justice, and considered the chief architect of the Constitution of India.

Great movie by sough indian industrySuriya plays a crusading lawyer, hell bent on revealing the truth behind three Irular (Scheduled Tribe) men who go missing while being in police custody.The superstar turns in an impeccable performance as he fastidiously chips away at the truth, only to discover layer upon layer of lies, caste hatred and cruelty.Despite having a big name star at his disposal, director T. J. Gnanavel deserves praise for letting the story take the driver's seat, never reducing to unnecessary 'massy' sequences or masala elements to drive the narrative forward.Lijimol Jose as the wife of Rajakannu (played by Manikandan) is an absolute force of nature in her role, delivering some of the best sequences in the film, turning in a performance a veteran would be proud of.Prakash Raj as usual excels in a supporting role while and Rajisha Vijayan had precious little screen time to make any sizeable impact.The music from Seal Roldan played very significant role, helping the audience to feel the pain of the beleaguered protagonists in the beginning and that of vindication and righteousness towards the climax.Jai Bhim does not rise up to the emotional highs of previous classic dramas based.

This film is based on true events that took place in Cuddalore district in 1993. In the original story, Rajakannu, a member of the Andai Kurumbar tribe whose main occupation was making bamboo baskets and agricultural labour, was accused of stealing jewels from a house that employed him. Based on the complaint, Rajkannu was taken into police custody.After suffering torture at the hands of the police, Rajakannu died in custody. To cover up their crimes, the local police moved his body late into the night, disposed of it in the neighbouring Tiruchirappalli (Trichy) district and later claimed that he had escaped from custody. Rajakannu's wife Parvathi, however, did not buy this story and sought help to locate her husband. Finally, she found a lawyer of the Madras High Court, K Chandru, who joined her quest for justice.K Chandru, who would later on become a well-respected and popular judge in the Madras High Court, filed a habeas corpus petition in the same court. After a 13-year legal battle, the court adjudicated that this was a case of custodial death and the accused police officials were sentenced to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment for the murder of Rajakannu. In an interview with The News Minute, he recalls how the police attempted to bribe Parvathi and him during the case. Chandru responded by throwing out the suitcase of money and the police from his office.Getting Parvathi justice for the custodial muder of her husband, however, is only one among the many incredible contributions of Justice K Chandru for the marginalised and downtrodden.In his six and a half years as a judge of the Madras High Court, he disposed of 96,000 cases, a remarkable feat which was only possible because of his immaculate planning and organisation.

Best movie ever seen in tamilPolice brutality has been a sensitive topic, touched upon by very few films and filmmakers, even when we keep hearing several such cases in the news. Films like Visaranai and Karnan paved the way for TJ Gnanavel's Jai Bhim to tell a harrowing social issue without the need to be preachy. Jai Bhim's first hour is a somewhat disturbing watch, with the cries of the oppressed both tugging at your heartstrings and coming across as slightly amplified. There's no subtlety at play. The punches are wholly felt, the screams are heard loud and clear. If you still don't, Sean Roldan's woeful score will drive the point home.

Review title: Example of 'How Fiction can endorse Reality'
Review_body: Frankly speaking, as an Indian audience we everyone knows the story, what will come next, what will happen to the victims & how the movie will end.The success of the movie is not keeping all as a suspense but showing exactly what we all expected. QOur subconscious knows that will happen, but consciously we are trying to cover the truth by thinking director will show some thing to entertain us.I think, director took a bold decision to make us (audience) to embarrasse by watching our co-citizens life, how our ignorance affecting them, how our perceptions about dress, speech, education etc makes some one guilty?We are not our conscious. We are our subconscious and this movie is about to disturb it.

Review title: Thrilling and Engaging: Best Movie of the year - Must Watch
Review_body: This is the best movie of the year, must watch!! The movie is based on true events and is about oppression by police on tribal communities.The movie is all about how certain sections of the society do not have access to even the basic rights such as justice, education, equality and right to live with dignity. This movie shows the ground reality of how underprivileged are tortured and falsely set up in cases just for the sake of closing up cases by police and so called privileged classes.I have lived in a village and have witnessed all this, this is an eye opening glimpse for us to atleast briefly understand what happens with underprivileged classes and how they live aside in a different corner of a village.Kudos to the director who has picked up such a complex topic and portrayed it so well, acting is top notch, screenplay is good, dialogues are superb. The movie is very engaging and does not feel long at any point in time.This is a gem of movies, must watch, don't miss it, they are made rarely!!

Right off the bat, I am glad to see the title of the movie. It has been years and now the people are comfortable and have resources to make such movies and depict ground reality.Story is fantastic, acting is powerful, message delivered is resounding, and bgm is honey to ears. Take a bow team!And for those blaming that the movie promotes divisiveness. The society has been divided for ages, based on state and caste. We live in unity but that doesn't mean that one should forget their identity. Any story that promotes this identity doesn't mean it is promoting divisiness. Learn to cherish each other's culture instead of trying to unify everything into one.

Really touched to my soul and it is based on True story how top people descrimimate with people shamed..Tamil Superstar @Suriya_offl not only exposed the atrocities done to us by making #JaiBhim film but also gave 1 crore rupees for the education of the children of the tribals on whom the film was made. Now those primitive.

Review title: One of the finest movies in the recent past
Review_body: Kudos to Surya and the Director Gnanavel for presenting this movie based on a true event. These are dark secrets in the Indian society that very few choose to talk and fight against. Wil surely get national award for Best actor Female, best actor Male, best movie, best director, best supporting crew, each and everyone lived it, doesn't seems like acting, they all just nailed it like anything.

One of the best movies that I've seen in the recent past. Suriya performance is absolutely stunning. Sinathalli aced the role... Amazing actress. I'm sure this movie will win multiple awards. This is no doubt an Oscar qualifier. Screenplay & direction is just amazing.One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.
In the name of creativity jai Bhim presented a corrupted version of true story .. Pathetic ... should be booked by the law for showing castes not in the original story as villainous...

While watching the movie the very particular thought that it is a real life move was completely disturbing. Tears rolled out understanding few fellow men just like us with families are left to be victimized by the system simply because the bureaucracy "can do it". It is a very powerful movie where the reality slaps you right in the face. How having a voter id or vote bank can protect some citizens from system abuse. Only concern was the viewers should have been informed that the police knew the real culprits and they have a share with the theft. That would have made us understand the severe torture meted out to the victims by the police. Revealing at the end might be good from a cinema point of view but it takes away the vital information from the viewers which they need to know to understand the entire brutality. This movie will bring in some required social changes in the society. The importance of adequate representation for every oppressed community was clearly evident. Tamil film industry will lead the infian movie industry in making movies based out of the social fabric of the society. Which while in remake will be missed out as was the case with asuran. Watch these type of movies in their native language to understand the actual pain and plight. My heartly congratulations in making a wonderful movieti enlighten the masses about oppression. Tamil cinemas kudos to you. Make fantabulous movies like these in the future as well.

Words are very less to express my Thanks to Suriya and whole team.Movie started with a poor but happy family, but one thinking made their life destroy. Sangini the character alone is strong character.Those who thinking this movie belongs to a perticulur community then they are missing India's Masterpiece movie. Writer directors specially taken care about the hearth about the movie which is social msg and real story, this movie has not a single dialogue with the word "Jai Bhim" but whole movie given a msg more than this word. In India lower caste people greetings with the word "Jai Bhim" just like western countries say "Hello" as a greeting word. "Jai Bhim" coming from Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar who is father of Indian constitution coming from lower cast community.This movie based on real story which is happened in 90s. Every scenes in the movie shows that the details study of whole team on each character.Director also not looks intrested in any hate communal dailouge, she sticked with the real story very well.Pregnant lady she is main character because story revolving around her her acting look more real.Sometimes movie gives feel like you are watching actual cctv footage of the real story.Thanks to Suriya because no Bollywood actor or director will dare to toch this topic as they are more interested in money making and undigestable comedy or same singam style movie.Bollywood need to take classes first from Tamil industry then we can expect from them atleast some better content.People Alredy proves that they want pure content without any masala, movie named "Sairat" (Marathi Movie) made a history in Marathi industry because people knows that marathi industry is full of Brahmin people. But Maharashtra liked the subject of "Sairat".Bollywood should know that people don't want glamour anymore they are hungry for an Art, they don't want all time white actress or Gym actors.People more intrest in pure art.Once again I would say "Jai Bhim" is a Masterpiece movie in Indian history.

Jai bhim showcast caste discrimination of tribal people,and police brutality and injustice in modern India in the nutshell. Police exploit the tribal people to close out case by frame them and torture them to acknowledge the crime that they never commit. The movie presents two big issues to the state and union governments, that are equlity caused by caste practices and Police Brutality. Police reforms to end the torture and fake cases and body cams and CCTV cameras on every police station. Equality or social justice to give the tribal people a chance to live a peaceful life such as land to live, educational opportunities, care for necessities, change to thought process of caste based inequality.That being said, the movie is well directed, the tribal actors and hero did a good job. Jai Bhim is a good title to show the fight against inequality since Dr. Ambakar name lived his life to fight inequality. Music just made the movie more natural. The scrpts are more natural, scenes and stories are well crafted, good job director. Thanks for producers Suriya and Jothika to make such a movie since it shows their commitment to the wellness of the society. Overall one of the best movies ever and every should watch it.

Review title: An excellent movie revealing systematic atrocities against the marginalized
Review_body: Firstly this is based off a true story. The victimized community, the lawyer who fought for them, the political leader who advocated for their justice are all there so do not believe the negative reviews that falsely proclaim it was a lie. This incident shown in the film has been proven in a court of law so to deny it would be unlawful in the first place.Now the movie...The marginalized community was depicted very accurately in the film. It is a sad fact that all over India these real, indigenous people, are still not allowed inside the main areas of the village/township, reduced to do menial jobs, mistreated, and even taken as perpetrators of crime without evidence. This is EXACTLY how they have been shown in the film.The filming crew has given extreme attention to detail when it comes to outlining their characters onscreen (this includes their accent, dressing, jobs, and lifestyle in general).Unlike many Indian films, there are no 'masala' scenes or songs showing heroism. The lawyer character fights for the truth and that's what is shown as well.One other thing to look for a movie is how well the central incident is taken by different characters in the film. The director has captured it perfectly and showcases how prejudice is interwoven in the society and while it is harmless to the unaffected, causes immense pain to the other.The long duration of the film does not cause even an iota of disinterest and puts you on the edge of your seat with its gripping reality.Movies like this should be welcome as eye-openers and proof that Indian flicks do not have to be all about dancing in the rain and catapulting villains.You can certainly find reviews that label this movie as fabricated, divisive etc. But remember, according the honorable (retired) judge of Madras High Court who actually handled the case when he was a lawyer, it was watered down a lot to reduce the gore and pain of the real incident.Kudos to Surya and team, and Amazon for taking up such a bold subject much needed for the society today.

How tribals were harassed by authorities and the pain they are going through is explicitly revealed in the film. It's the reality till date. A strong message against racism. Suriya sir as advocate and othet actors delivered a splendid performance.
I cried several times during the movie. I have done random acts of kindness when i saw needy and poor. It cleans my soul. Makes.me a better human being.

Review title: Story, cinematography, screenplay and Suriya made it a must-watch
Review_body: I haven't seen a better caste-based film in my life. This truly depicts the philosophy of Dr. Bhim Rao Ambedkar. Each scene has been crafted with details. The pace was optimum. Screenplay is fantastic. Each actors nailed their job with perfection. Hats off to Suriya for choosing this film and delivering it with such a brilliance. This is the other side of India which nobody talks about. Our country needs caste-based solution not caste-based politics or reservation.
You also need to watch this movie if you don't believe in racism and have the ability to fight them.What is really needed now is freedom, freedom from racism, freedom from religion.

Perfect story pace! Amazing and powerful casting. It truly highlights the current situation in most of the states in India. I'm shocked to hear that the entire story is based on true events. This message should reach the entire universe.

,An astounding must watch movie. Story touching the hard core issues in our existing society. Jai Bhim turned out to be a hard hitting, raw and powerful Court Room drama. The purpose of cinema is not just to entertain but also educate and empower the audience.It is definitely difficult to digest as it gives you goosebumps and eye popping experience. Superb Story , Script , Direction , Perfomance , BGM & Cinematography 🔥
Hatsoff to the entire crew.

Movie makers ko sukriya iske liye ye master piece dene k liye 2021 ki best movie india ke har insaan ko ye movie dekhni chahiye suriya sir ko tbhaut bada dhanyawad aise muddo par kam karne k liye kuch hi log h puri film industry me jo aise h wow.
Excellent Movie!!Great acting by Surya and all the supporting actors.Story and Screenplay are hard hitting.Hope to see more movies based on hero's among us.
A MOVIE IS SAID TO BE REFLECTION OF OUR SOCIETY.THIS MOVIE JUSTIFIES THE STATEMENT.BASED ON A TRUE STORY.MOTIVATIONAL AND ENLIGHTENING.WATCH IT TO KNOW OURSELVES.THANK YOU FOR WATCHING.

Review title: Hard to get back to reality
Review_body: The storyline and the characterization are so powerful and amazingly scripted that it is so hard to get back to reality. You can't help but feel the pain and sorrow of the people. The actors have played the characters with so depth . Hats off to Manikandan, Lijomol they really do deserve a national award.
Best actor needs to in bollywood. This type of movie can motivate to young generation to know how to solve any type of problem in their life to enjoy our life.
Got tears watching it. I want to become a lawyer inspired a lot from the movie and the character, Really amazing action by Surya and coactors with really good screen play.

It's definitely a mater piece and Oscar level!It highlights how rich tribals are at their heart and special skills despite their poverty and oppression from society. How ignorant was I while growing up to not realize such issues. Every level in society has good and bad people. It's foolishness to blindly blame a segment of people.Movie is well made to be realistic and not overdramatic. You will feel the pain, cry along and ponder over what we could do.I hope I gather some strength to get out of my comfort and raise my voice to at least +1 on the open issues.

Yet another unique perspective movie from South Indian cinema. Its a must watch, Portrays the unquestionable police brutality against the tribal communities and fight for justice.

It's not just a movie it is more than that,it depicts the country's ugly truth be it cast discrimination, be it oppression of so called lower cast people,be it perfoming untouchability. All these negative things still prevailing in India especially in remote areas of country. This movie's title it self is so powerful to give justice to vulnerable section of the society. Jay bhim is not just a slogan,it's a revolution of thoughts of Trinity i.e.liberty, equality and fraternity. Kudos to south film industry to put forward such a untouched and unheard real facts infront of the nation. Big salute to the person who's name is not even uttered in the movie but whole movie was revolving around his thoughts. Jay Bhim.

Cast:
I've seen Lijo Mol Jose in a previous movie and I was surprised when I saw her name in the cast as Sengoni. She has done a great job in this role, followed by Manikandan(Rajakannu) and finally Surya making us speechless with his performance. The other cast also did a great job.Music:
The songs in the movies may not be catchy or commercial but it helped the audience to feel the emotion which the movie wanted to convey. The BGM were so good and very apt for the film.Direction:
T. J Gnanavel has given quality movies in the past but this one is his masterpiece till date. It will be one of the best movies he has directed. The movie was simple, to the point and kept the audience nailed to the seat.This movie is based on true events and shows what injustice and hardship tribal community has gone through. It is a long film with 2hr and 40 min screen time but not even in one scene it felt slow. It has a nice pace and awesome dialogue and screenplay which will make almost 3 hrs feel so short. If the movie went on for another hour I wouldn't have complained.The film was finished and released even in this pandemic so hats off to the entire team. This is by far the best movie Ive seen this year. I wouldn't be surprised if bags multiple national awards.
A movie in which each and every actors done so fabulous regaurdles of age, even though it was a glimpse..uff those police station scenes really make you disturbed...so much realestic perfomance.

A must watch for all.. The movie addresses the injustices endured by the tribals.. This oppression is still being carried out in modern societies which needs to change.. They deserve the dignity of living.. Surya and Prakash Raj have nailed their roles getting into the skin of the character..

Review title: Must watch eye opening drama about lower cast people ,that govt and justice took granted nowadays
Review_body: Must watch eye opening drama about lower cast people ,that govt and justice took granted nowadays. Must watch eye opening drama about lower cast people ,that govt and justice took granted nowadays.

At one point in this nearly three-hour-long film, there is a goosebumps-raising moment that has a tribal woman - also the protagonist - turning her back on power, refusing to bow down to the system of dominance that has exploited the fruits of their labour, quite literally. Looking at it purely from the point of view of Tamil cinema's masala conventions, it is essentially a "mass" scene written for a Dalit character to give her a chance to look at her oppressors in the eye and perhaps tell them: "You cannot break me."

I've seen almost all the top rated movies of all over the world but never think of giving rating and review. For the first time I'm doing this. This movie is really a masterpiece and it will be the masterpiece for decades.

Review title: There is no compromise in the acting each and every character gave their best. Watching a movie for 160 minutes is pretty hard these days, but not once did I feel like it was
Review_body: There is no compromise in the acting each and every character gave their best. Watching a movie for 160 minutes is pretty hard these days, but not once did I feel like it was stretching. In this case, Prakash Raj is seen in a very good character, in the role of tribal, both the characters have given life to the whole movie, Surya sir's role is very good, who is in the character of Chandra who fights for the rights of poor tribals. Hai Jai Bhim movie is very good, you all must see a real best that happened in 1995, even today after the country's independence, such an incident keeps happening, for the first time in India, a movie has been made on the subjects of poor tribals. All the movies of Surya sir are number one and if Prakash Raj sir comes together then it becomes even more hit. The police have been brutalizing the tribals for years.
